title: @Meddler, State of Sona
body:
http://imgur.com/zPaKw78
What does Riot think of Sona? she has improved slightly from last season due to Windseeker's Blessing and Frost Queen's Claim.

But I "feel" as if she needs a little bit more to be where she needs to be; On the level of Thresh, Tahm Kench, Leona, Annie, Brand, Soraka, etc.

Yasuos with 125+ games are only winning [48%](http://champion.gg/champion/Yasuo) of the time. Explain that. Please find some way to spin that number into him still being OP somehow. I'm eager to see just what kind of mental gymnastics you'll pull off.
I find it cute that people use winrate alone to argue how good a champion is x3
I find it baffling that people can so easily discard the most meaningful indicator we have of a champions power level just to to preserve their own biases.

But Win Rate alone is....just win rate alone. It can be scewd by playrate. 
Take for example, champions with a small yet dedicated player-base. They can have lower play-rates but higher win rates because the smaller number of players using these champions are really good at them. 

At the moment Yasuo is more on the higher end of the play rate spectrum, thus skewing his winrate because there is a higher number of less experienced people are playing him. 

Call that personal bias if you want, but that's just the fact of the matter.

I don't care about overall winrate, that doesn't tell us anything of value. But I very much care about what the most experienced players of a champion are doing, as that gives you the best picture of how strong a champion is when played by people who know what they're doing. We have [that data](http://champion.gg/champion/Yasuo). In Plat+ elo, for Yasuos that have 125+ games on the champion, they're managing to win only 48% of the time. As in even the best Yasuo's are struggling to make him work right now. And that data is far harder to handwave away because your "Noobs playing Yasuo drag his winrate down" argument doesn't apply anymore.

if a fight is really really extended or its a long siege you will have mana issues but then again sona isnt supposed to be a soraka that keeps 5 people topped off

Her kit is easy to play. It's easy to pick her up and not be confused by what she's supposed to be doing and how she's supposed to do it (low skill floor). Her lack of a reliable escape and her low defensive stats, however, make being efficient with her harder than it may seem when you just look at her kit (surprisingly high skill cap for a champion meant to be beginner-level).

The challenge in playing Sona mostly lies in her environment, because she is very strong against the type of champions she's supposed to be strong against, and literally gets eaten alive by people who are supposed to be strong against her.

Riot said countless times they did not balance champion around how easy they are to play, but Sona proves they lie.
